pullRequest.body:
Concludes the work started in (TTBOMK) #11045 and #12850.
To make sure this is exhaustive, I wrote a syntax linter for this, which I will propose separately.

This uncovered some interesting interactions with the multi-goal linter:
in a few instances, about using the newer syntax, the sub-goal focusing also became obsolete.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9246606134/job/25434331507)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9246606134/job/25434331304)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9246606134/job/25434331449)
Maybe `obtain; swap` should be replaced by `rsuffices` instead
I tried using it and did not succeed. Be my guest to use it.

It looks like `rsuffices` only supports a "stream of conciousness" syntax. More precisely,
```lean
rsuffices h : p a := b
```
is equivalent to
```lean
obtain h : p a := b
```
not something like
```lean
obtain h : p a; rotate_left; exact b
```
@grunweg Could you please add `TODO`s in these cases? I guess, fixing `rsuffices` it out of scope for this PR, but let's have a reminder to swap these blocks back.
Why do you remove type annotations?

To stay below the line length limit; I am not sure if these types help readability that much.

I have restored them by putting a line break differently.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: remove remaining stream-of-conciousness obtain syntax

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: lint against stream-of-conciousness obtain syntax
